issue.title: [C++] Ability to "re-chunk" Tables or ChunkedArrays
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11370](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11370). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently, there is a `CombineChunks` functionality, but that combines all chunks into a single one. Often, you might want to rechunk to smaller set of chunks (combining small chunks into bigger ones)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11370?focusedCommentId=17271329) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Very useful. One question to consider is if it's possible to have a way to do this without doubling memory (or limiting excess memory use in some way)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11370?focusedCommentId=17271423) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
See also ARROW-7012.
